intro: Odontarrhena condensata subsp. condensata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed arrowroot, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, capsule-like fruits containing minute seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitats.
